subject: Present: added callback "copy_region"
commitMessage:
Present: added callback "copy_region"

This callback has been added in order that DDX can do copy by itself.
For example for implementation a SWAP mode.

Change-Id: I68e85384f1767fc24cc07528b84e5763f13541c3
Signed-off-by: Roman Marchenko <r.marchenko@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Verified+1
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: present: Make window MSC offset 0 initially
commitMessage:
present: Make window MSC offset 0 initially

The MSC offset used by a window is adjusted as the window moves
between screens, and between shown/unshown. The value shouldn't
matter, but it's helpful for debugging to have window MSC values be
the same as the CRTC MSC at first.

This patch introduces a unique CRTC value so that Present can detect
the first time a window is a PresentPixmap destination and set the MSC
offset to zero, rather than using the fake MSC value as the previous
window MSC.

Change-Id: Ic68a4609f6cf4a10c47bb42555374df230b1c238
Signed-off-by: Keith Packard <keithp@keithp.com>
Reviewed-by: Eric Anholt <eric@anholt.net>

subject: - xorg-server should not try to build into a pure wayland platform..
commitMessage:
- xorg-server should not try to build into a pure wayland platform..

Tizen devel  | Tizen release
_____________|______________
succeeded    | succeeded
excluded     | excluded
broken       |
failed       |
unresolvable |
blocked      |
locked       |
note:
    - The disabled status is only
      allowed for OBS administration.

subject: Enable DGA to build xf86-video-fbdev

subject: XKB: cache xkbcomp output for fast start-up v9 for 1.13.3
commitMessage:
XKB: cache xkbcomp output for fast start-up v9 for 1.13.3

xkbcomp outputs will be cached in files with hashed keymap as
names. This saves boot time for around 1s on commodity netbooks.

v9: michael.i.doherty@intel.com added support for libgcrypt

v8: pekka.lundstrom@jollamobile.com reworked patch for 1.13.0

V7: reworked Li Yan's patch for v1.8.99.903

v6: rebased to v1.7.99.901

v5: now using a much bigger xkbKeyMapBuf (100k) since the XKB to be
    complied may be very large (as seen with
    gnome-keyboard-properties), rebased to v1.6.1

Signed-off-by: Yan Li <yan.i.li@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Liu Xinyun <xinyun.liu@intel.com>

Bug-Tizen: TZPC-4049

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

To verify the changes, reboot once after installing new xorg-server package. Check that .xkm files exist in /var/lib/xkm/compiled or /usr/share/X11/xkbcomp/compiled (symlinks)
Check the X logfile, you should only see "reuse" not "generate" messages from this patch on second boot.
Note that on some devices this has very significant boot-time savings.
Also verify that gnome-control-center functions correctly, and that 'setxkbmap' functions as expected. Running 'setxkbmap us' from gb will result in a generation message in X log. re-running will show "reuse"

Changes verified locally in clean environments.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This will also fix P2 bug :

Bug-Tizen: TZPC-4111
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Cache xkbcomp output
commitMessage:
Cache xkbcomp output

Construct a unique filename based on the display name and the RMLVO
values. If that file contains valid contents, use it. Otherwise,
compile the keymap to that file and don't unlink it so that it will be
re-used the next time the server runs.

v2: Only cache files that get written to XKM_OUTPUT_DIR.
    Add --enable-xkb-cache config option to enable this behaviour

Signed-off-by: Keith Packard <keithp@keithp.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

This is essentially the same as the original patch by Keith Packard. I've slightly modified it to have the caching disabled by default (which is enabled in the dependant commit following this). This is per the mailing list commits I have previously seen.

Work needs to happen to get this upstream. We should definitely enable this in our own repos though.
